reasoning: Senile osteoporosis is a chronic condition affecting elderly population. Reported as prevalence: WHO and NIH data show approximately 30% of elderly (>70 years) have osteoporosis, translating to ~30,000 per 100k in affected age groups.
source: WHO Technical Report Series 921 (2003). Assessment of fracture risk and its application to screening for postmenopausal osteoporosis
